content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
I received a message from the AI to install the "alltrails" package using the "pip install alltrails" command. However, the installation failed with an error message stating that no matching distribution was found. The error message also suggested updating pip to the latest version. I used the `web_search` command to search for information on how to install the `alltrails` Python package, which returned several results. One of the results was the Python Packaging User Guide, which provides instructions for installing packages using pip and virtual environments.
"""

Latest Development:
"""
[Message(role='assistant', content='{'thoughts': {'text': 'I want to explore some hiking trails in the Brno Reservoir area. I remember trying to install the "alltrails" package before, but it failed. I should try updating pip and installing the package again. I can use the `execute_shell` command to update pip with the command "pip install --upgrade pip".', 'reasoning': 'Updating pip to the latest version may resolve the issue with installing the "alltrails" package.', 'plan': '- Update pip with the command "pip install --upgrade pip".\n- Try installing the "alltrails" package again with the command "pip install alltrails".\n- Use the `execute_python_code` command to import the "alltrails" package and explore hiking trails in the Brno Reservoir area.', 'criticism': 'I should have updated pip before trying to install the "alltrails" package the first time.', 'speak': 'I will update pip and try installing the "alltrails" package again to explore hiking trails in the Brno Reservoir area.'}, 'command': {'name': 'execute_shell', 'args': {'command_line': 'pip install --upgrade pip'}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content='Command execute_shell returned: STDOUT:
b'Requirement already satisfied: pip in /usr/local/lib/python3.10/site-packages (23.0.1)\nCollecting pip\n  Downloading pip-23.1.2-py3-none-any.whl (2.1 MB)\n     \xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81 2.1/2.1 MB 7.8 MB/s eta 0:00:00\nInstalling collected packages: pip\n  Attempting uninstall: pip\n    Found existing installation: pip 23.0.1\n    Uninstalling pip-23.0.1:\n      Successfully uninstalled pip-23.0.1\nSuccessfully installed pip-23.1.2\n'
STDERR:
b"WARNING: Running pip as the 'root' user can result in broken permissions and conflicting behaviour with the system package manager. It is recommended to use a virtual environment instead: https://pip.pypa.io/warnings/venv\n"', type='action_result'), Message(role='assistant', content='{'thoughts': {'text': 'I have updated pip to the latest version. Now, I will try installing the "alltrails" package again with the command "pip install alltrails".', 'reasoning': 'Updating pip to the latest version may resolve the issue with installing the "alltrails" package.', 'plan': '- Try installing the "alltrails" package again with the command "pip install alltrails".\n- Use the `execute_python_code` command to import the "alltrails" package and explore hiking trails in the Brno Reservoir area.', 'criticism': 'I should have updated pip before trying to install the "alltrails" package the first time.', 'speak': 'I will try installing the "alltrails" package again to explore hiking trails in the Brno Reservoir area.'}, 'command': {'name': 'execute_shell', 'args': {'command_line': 'pip install alltrails'}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content="Command execute_shell returned: STDOUT:
b''
STDERR:
b'ERROR: Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement alltrails (from versions: none)\nERROR: No matching distribution found for alltrails\n'", type='action_result'), Message(role='assistant', content='{'thoughts': {'text': 'The installation of the "alltrails" package has failed again with the error message "No matching distribution found for alltrails". I will use the `web_search` command to search for alternative ways to install the package.', 'reasoning': 'Searching the web may provide alternative ways to install the "alltrails" package.', 'plan': '- Use the `web_search` command to search for alternative ways to install the "alltrails" package.\n- Use the information found to install the package.\n- Use the `execute_python_code` command to import the "alltrails" package and explore hiking trails in the Brno Reservoir area.', 'criticism': 'I should have searched the web for alternative ways to install the "alltrails" package earlier.', 'speak': 'I will search the web for alternative ways to install the "alltrails" package.'}, 'command': {'name': 'web_search', 'args': {'query': 'how to install alltrails python package'}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content='Command web_search returned: [
    {
        "title": "Installing Packages — Python Packaging User Guide",
        "href": "https://packaging.python.org/tutorials/installing-packages/",
        "body": "Requirements files Installing from VCS Installing from other Indexes Installing from a local src tree Installing from local archives Installing from other sources Installing Prereleases Installing \"Extras\" Requirements for Installing Packages ¶ This section describes the steps to follow before installing other Python packages."
    },
    {
        "title": "Installing packages using pip and virtual environments - Python",
        "href": "https://packaging.python.org/guides/installing-using-pip-and-virtual-environments/",
        "body": "It's used to install and update packages. You'll need to make sure you have the latest version of pip installed. Unix/macOS Debian and most other distributions include a python-pip package; if you want to use the Linux distribution-provided versions of pip, see Installing pip/setuptools/wheel with Linux Package Managers."
    },
    {
        "title": "python - How to install packages offline? - Stack Overflow",
        "href": "https://stackoverflow.com/questions/11091623/how-to-install-packages-offline",
        "body": "Mar 13, 2013 at 21:42 Add a comment 13 Answers Sorted by: 470 On the system that has access to internet The pip download command lets you download packages without installing them: pip download -r requirements.txt (In previous versions of pip, this was spelled pip install --download -r requirements.txt .)"
    },
    {
        "title": "Installing Python Modules — Python 3.11.4 documentation",
        "href": "https://docs.python.org/3/installing/index.html",
        "body": "The following command will install the latest version of a module and its dependencies from the Python Package Index: python -m pip install SomePackage Note For POSIX users (including macOS and Linux users), the examples in this guide assume the use of a virtual environment."
    },
    {
        "title": "Installing and Managing Python Packages - PyCharm Guide - JetBrains",
        "href": "https://www.jetbrains.com/pycharm/guide/tutorials/getting-started-pycharm/installing-and-managing-python-packages/",
        "body": "Installing and Managing Python Packages How to work with Python packages in your project. In the previous step, we set up a Python interpreter for our project. But sometimes our project depends on Python packages and getting those setup can be tricky. Package Tool Window"
    },
    {
        "title": "How to Manually Install Python Packages - ActiveState",
        "href": "https://www.activestate.com/resources/quick-reads/how-to-manually-install-python-packages/",
        "body": "To install a package that includes a setup.py file, open a command or terminal window and: cd into the root directory where setup.py is located Enter: python setup.py install Setup.py Build Environment Packages installed with setup.py have build requirements that developers must adhere to. However, some requirements are optional. Examples"
    },
    {
        "title": "Is there a way to automatically install required packages in Python ...",
        "href": "https://stackoverflow.com/questions/48314010/is-there-a-way-to-automatically-install-required-packages-in-python",
        "body": "1) File a bug with PyCharm -- they are really on top of it. 2) Since PyCharm creates a virtual environment for you, all you need to do is run it from the virtual environment in the terminal. You don't need to reinstall anything. - SteveJ Jan 18, 2018 at 5:08"
    },
    {
        "title": "Importing and Exporting files - AllTrails Help",
        "href": "https://support.alltrails.com/hc/en-us/sections/360006411352-Importing-and-Exporting-files",
        "body": "How do I upload a file to AllTrails? How do I export a file from AllTrails? Are map types and map details included in file exports? How do I convert my files? How do I get a file from AllTrails onto my GPS device? Explore. Countries; Regions; Cities; Parks; Trails; Maps. My maps; Create map; Print maps; Route Converter; Company. About; Jobs; Press;"
    }
]', type='action_result')]
"""
